intro: Sloanea cruenta, commonly known as the bloodwood tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, reddish-brown bark that exudes a sticky resin when cut. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Sloanea cruenta produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
